intro: Isotrema versicolor, commonly known as the variable isotrema, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that vary in shape and size depending on environmental conditions. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green or yellowish in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. Isotrema versicolor is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
